definition: to burn incense at a temple
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
to go on a pilgrimage and offer incense (idiom)

sentences.english: In May, people tour the Gold Fish Pond, offer incense at Zhongding and the Yaowang (God of Medicines) Temple.
sentences.chinese: 五月遊金魚池，中頂進香，藥王廟進香。

sentences.english: In May, people tour the Gold Fish Pond, offer incense at Zhongding and the Yaowang (God of Medicines) Temple.
sentences.chinese: 五月遊金魚池，中頂進香，藥王廟進香。

sentences.english: Since the year you and her on the first date, together go to temple pilgrimages .
sentences.chinese: 新年以來你和她第一次約會，一起去廟裏進香。

sentences.english: Visitors to my temple like to get problems to solve.
sentences.chinese: 好多人來廟裏進香，是想要帶問題回去研究的。

sentences.english: Early in the morning went Jimingsi incense; eat a bowl of vegetarian Jimingsi famous face.
sentences.chinese: 清晨先去雞鳴寺進香，喫一碗雞鳴寺著名的齋面。

sentences.english: Pilgrimage after the New Year give grandparents and uncles.
sentences.chinese: 進香過後，就給祖父母及叔叔們拜年。
